dt: {bc}a legal agreement to {a_link|submit} to the decision of arbitrators
{bc}an act of {a_link|submitting} something (as for consideration or inspection)
{bc}the condition of being {a_link|submissive}, humble, or compliant
{bc}an act of submitting to the authority or control of another

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}submission-, submissio{/it} act of lowering, from {it}submittere{/it}
shortdef: a legal agreement to submit to the decision of arbitrators
an act of submitting something (as for consideration or inspection); also : something submitted (such as a manuscript)
the condition of being submissive, humble, or compliant

dt.t: made some revisions and {wi}resubmitted{/wi} the assignment
… urged the House leadership to withdraw the bill and {wi}resubmit{/wi} it in the next Congress.
Almost everyone plays the ratings game, trimming and {wi}resubmitting{/wi} films for less restrictive designations.
